SCENE.TITLE: SCENE II. A camp near Forres.
SCENE.STAGEDIR: Alarum within. Enter DUNCAN, MALCOLM, DONALBAIN, LENNOX, with Attendants, meeting a bleeding Sergeant

SPEECH.SPEAKER: DUNCAN
MALCOLM
SPEECH.LINE: What bloody man is that? He can report,
As seemeth by his plight, of the revolt
The newest state.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MALCOLM
SPEECH.LINE: This is the sergeant
Who like a good and hardy soldier fought
'Gainst my captivity. Hail, brave friend!
Say to the king the knowledge of the broil
As thou didst leave it.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: Sergeant
SPEECH.LINE: Doubtful it stood;
As two spent swimmers, that do cling together
And choke their art. The merciless Macdonwald--
Worthy to be a rebel, for to that
The multiplying villanies of nature
Do swarm upon him--from the western isles
Of kerns and gallowglasses is supplied;
And fortune, on his damned quarrel smiling,
Show'd like a rebel's whore: but all's too weak:
For brave Macbeth--well he deserves that name--
Disdaining fortune, with his brandish'd steel,
Which smoked with bloody execution,
Like valour's minion carved out his passage
Till he faced the slave;
Which ne'er shook hands, nor bade farewell to him,
Till he unseam'd him from the nave to the chaps,
And fix'd his head upon our battlements.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: DUNCAN
SPEECH.LINE: What bloody man is that? He can report,
As seemeth by his plight, of the revolt
The newest state.
